title: October 31: Television Interview
description: Simulate a live televised interview to test composure, adaptability, and message discipline under high-pressure media questioning.

tasks.prompt: Softball Opening: Answer warm-up questions on local color, school visit highlights, or human-interest topics. Demonstrate composure and likability.
Policy Questions: Respond concisely to queries on community safety, education policy, fiscal responsibility, and foreign affairs. Provide evidence-based answers with clear principles.
Press / Gotcha Phase: Handle tougher follow-up questions that press for contradictions, opponent specifics, or recent controversies. Use bridging and accountability techniques.
Closing Challenge: Deliver a decisive, principled closing statement that reinforces key messages and voter recall.

narrator: You’re live on air. Begin with a calm opening, stay concise during policy questions, withstand the pressure of the gotcha phase, and close with a memorable, principled statement.
readingSummary: Televised interviews test composure, clarity, and message discipline.
Candidates progress through four phases: Softball opening, Policy questions, Gotcha phase, and Closing challenge.

tasksDetails.prompt: Warm-up questions; answer concisely, demonstrate composure and likability.

Handle rapid, challenging follow-ups; practice bridging and accountability.

sources: General Election October 31 – Television Interview Scenario

outcome.description: AI scores responses, adjusting voter approval, Candidate Coins (CC), and campaign momentum. Immediate feedback provided on clarity, factual framing, and persuasive strength. Sample answers saved for review or debate prep.
